original_title: Satellite Provides Detailed Data on Antarctic Ice
original_content:
Ever since the first satellites started imaging the Earth, scientists have been using the data gathered to learn more about our planet and improve the lives of its inhabitants. From weather forecasting to improving crop yields, satellites have been put to work in a wide array of tasks. The data they gather can go beyond imaging as well. A new Chinese satellite known as Fengyun-3E is using some novel approaches to monitor Antarctic sea ice in order to help scientists better understand the changing climate at the poles.
While it is equipped with a number of other sensors, one of the more intriguing is a piece of equipment called WindRad which uses radar to measure wind at various locations and altitudes based on how the radar waves bounce off of the atmosphere at various places.  Scientists have also been able to use this sensor to monitor sea ice, and can use the data gathered to distinguish new sea ice from ice which is many years old, allowing them to better understand ice formation and loss at the poles. Its also the first weather satellite to be placed in an early morning orbit, allowing it to use the long shadows cast by the sun on objects on Earths surface to gather more information than a satellite in other orbits might be able to.
With plenty of other imaging sensors on board and a polar orbit, it has other missions beyond monitoring sea ice. But the data that it gathers around Antarctica should give scientists more information to improve climate models and understand the behavior of sea ice at a deeper level. Weather data from satellites like these isnt always confined to academia, though. Plenty of weather satellites broadcast their maps and data unencrypted on radio bands that anyone can access.
title: 南極海氷をモニタリングするための中国の新しい衛星
body: 地球のイメージングを始めた最初の衛星から、科学者たちは地球の情報を学び、その生活を改善するためにデータを活用してきた。天気予報から作物の収量向上まで、衛星はさまざまなタスクで活用されている。収集されたデータはイメージングにとどまらず、気候変動を理解するため、南極の海氷を監視するためにも使用されている。中国の新しい衛星「風雲3E」は、ラダーウェーブが大気と交差する場所によって風速を測定し、海氷を監視するためのセンサーを搭載している。これにより、氷の形成や喪失をよりよく理解できるようになる。この衛星は、他のイメージングセンサーや極軌道に加えて、異なる任務も持っている。しかし、南極周辺で収集されるデータは、気候モデルを改善し、海氷の振る舞いをより深く理解するために科学者に有益な情報を提供するだろう。
